name: Holiday Inn Toronto Downtown Centre

reviews.text: Not the best stay. Prices were overinflated due to a large conference in town. Service was slow even at non-busy times. Colleagues had boxes delivered which they had to spend ages hunting down and there was no hot water at 8:30am 2 days in a row. Not the best area of town either, particularly over towards Church Street. Gym is very small and the swimming pool was extremely overheated. Also the changing rooms were absolutely freezing cold with no heating at all. Would not have remotely considered getting changed in there!
reviews.title: Overpriced for what we got

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here on points for a weekend away. The location is good, but the overall experience was not as good as can be expected at other Holiday Inns.
reviews.title: Some major, some minor improvements to live up to the Holiday Inn brand

reviews.text: Location is good, and parking was easy. The lobby is nice and there is a supermarket a few steps away which is excellent (Loblaws). Daio Sushi directly opposite is also excellent and highly rated on urban spoon.
reviews.title: Great Location, Poor Climate Control
Very well appointed hotel in heart of Toronto
“Good mid-range downtown hotel”
reviews.text: Proximity to the College Street subway station makes this Holiday Inn a good choice for downtown accommodations. Combined with free Wi-Fi and modern upgrades, you have comfort and convenience at competitive rates. The rooms may be small, and the bathrooms even tighter, but their comfy beds and pillow options make for a pleasant stay although one of the rooms had odors emanating from the shower drain. Besides looking into some minor plumbing issues, improvements can also be made to staff service, which was inconsistent at best. If planning any meetings or events here, beware of invoices that are hard to decipher.

The only positive about this Hotel is the location....rooms are small and overheated and the ice machines don't work. Check your credit card after check-out because if not you could be charged for damages that weren't done by you.This happened to us and after 3 days of dealing with staff members who seemed to be making up different stories as to what the charges were for, we finally had the $300 reversed (Hotel Manager agreed there were no damages!!).
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else......anywhere else!!!

reviews.text: Priority Club members are supposed to get extra perks, which included 2 warm bottles of water (for 2 rooms) and an ice machine that didn't work....
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.text: My adivce to anybody that stays there is to take a good look around the room and call the Front Desk right away for anything that isn't perfect (stain on carpet, crack in furniture) if not you will end up being charged!!
reviews.title: Great location and a good stay

reviews.text: I loved this hotel; we got a very good rate with Hotwire. Room was modern and cosy. Bed was comfortable and the hotel is very centrally located with lots of restaurants along the street, as well as a large Loblaws supermarket a few doors down. Subway is also just a few minutes away. Car park is CAD25 per night which is normal for Toronto but makes a few days stay rather expensive. The garage is also a very tight fit and was somewhat nerve wracking to park in.
reviews.title: Would definitely return; good value for money

reviews.text: My husband & I & our 2 kids (ages 5 & 7) stayed here for 2 nights last week. Yes, the rooms are tiny, but they are well-designed. We were pleased with how clean the rooms were, & my kids loved the pool area. The location was great: very close to Eaton Centre.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable--will stay here again!

reviews.text: One area of concern: when I was researching hotels in Toronto, a review of this particular hotel mentioned that the fire alarm went off during the night. Well, during our first night we too were awakened by an alarm! Does this happen often at this hotel? Very strange.
reviews.title: NIce budget hotel

reviews.text: Overall, though, we were pleased, and will likely stay here again. As Priority Club members, we got special perks and stayed on the Priority Club floor, which was quiet and had a great view of the city!
reviews.title: Our third stay; treated like royalty

reviews.text: This holiday inn is a nice newly refurbished hotel! the location is very good and central just around the corner from Dudas Square! The negative points were : The shower pressure was so low I thought I' d be doing dry cleaning! the water was almost cold and dont expect shower gel bring your own as they only offer a small awfull soap! The heating system was out of control! 2 options I found too hot or off ?...see previous reviews! Anyway since I had my own shower gel and I got over the water issue I had a great stay! I thought the staff were nice at breakfast ( cheap looking items!:-) )and concierge too. Overwall it is a nice hotel if you get a nice deal online! Let me finnish by saying the beds were very confortable too!
reviews.title: Close to the City Centre

reviews.text: I don't know where to start... from the moment we found the FULL parking lot, the whole nightmare began. We then had to use the parking lot next door that you can only pay for for 12 hours at a time. Then we had to walk down the steepest on-ramp with all our bags. Once we got to the lobby there was a lineup of about 20 people before us and two people working.once we got to the front kf the line the girl working told us she gave our reservation away and had two double beds for my boyfriend and I who originally reserved a king. She said there was nothing she could do about it and wouldn't giv us a refund. We asked to speak to the manager who ended up giving us someone else's reserved room. Then it didn't end there... at 1 am the fire alarm went off and for about an hr everyone frantically had no idea what happened. It wasn't until we checked out that they told us what happened- that there was a fire one floor below us, something they should be obliged to tell you earlier!! Overall I would never recommend this hotel to anyone
reviews.title: The worst

reviews.text: Can't really complain about much. Asked for a higher floor and got it. As a Priority Club member I got a bag with some waters and snacks for free. The bed probably isn't the best, but it got the job done.
reviews.title: What I needed

reviews.text: I stayed with my family at Holiday Inn Toronto Downtown Centre for 7 nights during December 2012.
reviews.title: The Tiniest Room Ever

reviews.text: The hotel location is the only positive thing, one minute walking from the metro station and the street car station with an easy access to a lot of restaurants, cafes, shops and 10 minute walking to Eaton Centre.
reviews.title: Very Good!!!

reviews.text: Other than that the rooms are very small, I mean very small, this is the tiniest room I ever seen I had to upgrade to a suite and pay a different of CAD1000 .
reviews.title: Good updated hotel in a good area.

aka: Holiday Inn Toronto Downtown Centre Hotel
